Parameters: boolean: whether to show a cancel button
setShowCancelButton(boolean).Description: Sets whether a cancel button at the top right should be shown in the notification on platforms before Lollipop. Prior to Lollipop, there was a bug in the framework which prevented the developer to make a notification dismissable again after having used the same notification as the ongoing notification for a foreground service. When the notification was posted by @B_android#app#Service#startForeground_E@, but then the service exited foreground mode via @B_android#app#Service#stopForeground_E@, without removing the notification, the notification stayed ongoing, and thus not dismissable. This is a common scenario for media notifications, as this is exactly the service lifecycle that happens when playing/pausing media. Thus, a workaround is provided by the support library: Instead of making the notification ongoing depending on the playback state, the support library provides the ability to add an explicit cancel button to the notification. Note that the notification is enforced to be ongoing if a cancel button is shown to provide a consistent user experience. Also note that this method is a no-op when running on Lollipop and later.

Parameters: PendingIntent: the intent to be sent when the cancel button is pressed
setCancelButtonIntent(android.app.Pendin.Description: Sets the pending intent to be sent when the cancel button is pressed. See @B_android#support#v7#app#NotificationCompat#MediaStyle#setShowCancelButton_E@.

setMediaSession(android.support.v4.media.Description: Attaches a @B_android#support#v4#media#session#MediaSessionCompat#Token_E@ to this Notification to provide additional playback information and control to the SystemUI.

Parameters: int: the indices of the actions to show in the compact notification view
setShowActionsInCompactView(int...).Description: Requests up to 3 actions (by index in the order of addition) to be shown in the compact notification view.

ClassDesc: Notification style for media playback notifications. In the expanded form, @B_android#app#Notification#bigContentView_E@, up to 5 @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Action_E@s specified with @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#addAction_E@ will be shown as icon-only pushbuttons, suitable for transport controls. The Bitmap given to @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setLargeIcon_E@ will be treated as album artwork. Unlike the other styles provided here, MediaStyle can also modify the standard-size @B_android#app#Notification#contentView_E@; by providing action indices to @B_android#support#v7#app#NotificationCompat#MediaStyle#setShowActionsInCompactView_E@ you can promote up to 3 actions to be displayed in the standard view alongside the usual content. Notifications created with MediaStyle will have their category set to @B_android#app#Notification#CATEGORY_TRANSPORT_E@ unless you set a different category using @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setCategory_E@. Finally, if you attach a @B_android#media#session#MediaSession#Token_E@ using @B_android#support#v7#app#NotificationCompat#MediaStyle#setMediaSession_E@, the System UI can identify this as a notification representing an active media session and respond accordingly (by showing album artwork in the lockscreen, for example). To use this style with your Notification, feed it to @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder#setStyle_E@ like so:
